chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel D Simons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to each other.  If sentence is revoked, the defendant is to receive credit for 11 days served.

miscConds.notes: Court costs of $518.00 have been paid in full, forfeiting the cash bond on file.  Balance to be refunded to the poster.

-No Contact with the victims.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-No Contact with any females under the age of 18 years old without supervision as determined by the agent.
-Undergo sex offender treatment and any follow-up.
-Register as sex offender and remain compliant.
-Undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with any follow-up.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber and to commence within 60 days.

11:Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.    Atty Haase and defendant have received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Statement by Jamie Simons.  Sentencing argument by ADA Vanden Branden.  Sentencing argument by Atty Haase.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 5 years, concurrent to each other.

Count 5 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years, concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS (EACH COUNT):

-Ct 1 - 1 year county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.
-Court costs.
-No Contact with the victims.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-No Contact with any females under the age of 18 years old without supervision as determined by the agent.
-Undergo sex offender treatment and any follow-up.
-Register as sex offender and remain compliant.
-Undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with any follow-up.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Statement by Atty Haase regarding sentence credit.  Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 11 days, if probation becomes revoked.

1:45 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - was previously set for jury trial and an agreement has been reached.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  ADA recites agreement - State will amend count 1 to 3rd Degree Sexual Assault in violation of 940.225(3) and also pleas to count 5, with the balance of the counts being dismissed and read-in.  Atty Haase concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to amended count 1 and count 5.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a Pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days.  Court sets for Sentencing on November 7, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.
